inlineContent.text: The mesh network object contains information about known Nodes, Provisioners,
Network and Application Keys, Groups and Scenes, as well as the exclusion list.
The configuration does not contain any sequence numbers, IV Index, or other
network properties that change without the action from the Provisioner.
The structire of this class is compatible with Mesh Configuration Database 1.0.1.

abstract.text: The Bluetooth Mesh Network configuration.
The Publish object defines the publication configuration for a Model.

Returns the next available Unicast Address from the local Provisioner’s range
that can be assigned to a new node with given number of elements.
The 0’th element is identified by the node’s Unicast Address.
Each following element is identified by a subsequent Unicast Address.
An array that include information about Application Keys used in the
network.
Removes a Provisioner at the given index.
Random 128-bit UUID allows differentiation among multiple mesh networks.

that can be assigned to a new node with 1 element. The element will be
identified by the returned address.

Sets the given Provisioner as the one that will be used for
provisioning new nodes, sending commands, etc. It will be moved
to index 0 in the list of provisioners in the mesh network.

An array of Scenes in the network.
Returns whether the given Provisioner is set as the main
Provisioner. The local Provisioner will be used to perform all
provisioning and communication on this device. Every device
should use a different Provisioner to set up devices in the
same mesh network to avoid conflicts with addressing nodes.

An array of provisioner objects that includes information about known
Provisioners and ranges of addresses and scenes that have been allocated
to these Provisioners.

Adds the Provisioner and assigns a Unicast Address to it.
This method does nothing if the Provisioner is already added to the
mesh network.
Disables the configuration capabilities by un-assigning Provisioner’s address.
Un-assigning an address will delete the Provisioner’s Node. This results in the
Provisioner not being able to send or receive mesh messages in the mesh network.
However, the provisioner will still retain it’s provisioning capabilities.
Checks whether the given ranges are available for allocation to a new

otherwise.

if the mesh network
does not have any.
